title: Technical Account Manager , ES - Strategic Industries
description:
***This job is with Amazon, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Description**
 Sales, Marketing and Global Services (SMGS)
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Would you like to join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and help customers of all industries and sizes gain the best value and service from AWS? AWS Enterprise Support, Technical Account Managers (TAM) support our customers' creative and transformative spirit of innovation across all technologies, including Compute, Storage, Database, Big Data, Application-level Services, Networking, Serverless, Deployment, Security and more. This is not a sales role, but rather an opportunity to be the principal technical advisor and 'voice of the customer' to organizations ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500 enterprises.
   

  

 The TAM role is not directly hands on keyboard within the customer's environment for troubleshooting customer support issues, rather you will work with appropriate engineers and service teams to see issues through to resolution. More importantly you will work proactively to help craft and execute strategies to drive our customers' adoption and use of AWS services, including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT, and many more.
   

  

 Your technical acumen and customer-facing skills will enable you to effectively represent AWS within a customer's environment, and drive discussions with senior leadership regarding incidents, trade-offs, support and risk management.
   

  

 You will provide advocacy and strategic technical guidance to help plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers' AWS environments operationally healthy and resilient.
   

  

 The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS. This position will require the ability to travel 10% or more as needed.
   

  

 The TAM is the centerpiece of value to our Enterprise Support customers. If you wish to be at the forefront of innovation, come join us!
   

  

**About The Team**
 Why AWS?
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.
   

  

**About AWS**
 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it's in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience with operational parameters and troubleshooting for at least four of the following technical domains: Compute/ Storage/ Networking/ CDN/ Databases/ DevOps/ Big Data and Analytics/ Security/ Applications Development in a distributed systems environment
* Working with engineering/ technology teams for large customers or a major segment of a large entity in the Public Sector, Enterprise or Start-up industry


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Leading technical internal enterprise teams or external customer-facing experience with C-suite influence
* Professional oral and written communication skills, presenting to an audience containing one or more decision maker(s)
* Experience in operational services or support environment
* Experience in Automotive and/or Manufacturing industries
* Experience in influencing management stakeholders on technical, operational or business strategic decisions
* Experience with AWS services and/ or other cloud offerings
* Proficiency with Swedish language


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Product & Tech organisation
 





 Our Product & Technology organisation drives the development of Trustly’s products. The cross functional teams collectively work with innovative ideas, development of products and platform and set the vision and strategy for the problem spaces they own. The Product & Tech
 

 organisation
 

 consists of a bit more than 200 people spread across Stockholm, Lisbon, Örebro, Paris, London and Izmir. 
 









 All teams consist of a product manager, an engineering manager, a lead developer and engineers. Some teams also have designers and analytics competence in the team. They all work closely together to enable new products and features within existing products within Europe and to make sure the payment platform runs without interruptions and with high performance.
 








**About the role
 





 We are now looking to strengthen our engineering capacity within Product & Technology with one more senior backend engineer. We operate in an agile culture, allowing our teams to take on full responsibility from code to on-call. As a senior engineer you will join the Payout team and be part of building the next generation Payout product service.
 





  




**What you'll do** 
* In your role as a senior backend engineer, you will play a key role in developing, maintaining and improving our platform and digital products
* Be a part of our development team and build new product features, as well as our next-generation system platform
* Develop and build scalable systems together with our engineering teams, ensuring high quality in automation and monitoring
* Work closely with other engineers, lead devs, engineering managers and product managers on a daily basis, understanding and conveying the business value in what we build and why we build it
* Be a key team member and a role model for other engineers, enabling others to thrive



  




**Who you are:** 
* 5 years + of experience working with Java and modern frontend frameworks (preferably React) and building robust and scalable systems in agile environments
* A natural leader with a can-do attitude and with a proactive approach
* Comfortable in full development lifecycle, from drafting application design to implementing and supporting it
* Experienced in service-based architecture and microservices
* Experienced in Postgres, Kubernetes, Linux, Kafka, Docker, Datadog and Spring boot
* Experienced working with cloud based solutions, preferably AWS
* Proficient in troubleshooting complex systems
* Passionate for working in a DevOps environment, considering ownership and excellence fundamental parts of development
* Interested in researching and introducing new technologies to drive innovation in your team
* Fluent in English






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.****

title: Tech Lead / Rust Developer - Engagement
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 800+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're on the lookout for a Tech Lead / Rust developer to join our team and play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between our low-level code and cloud infrastructure. As part of our dynamic Engagement team, you'll be at the forefront of shaping the customer journey post-purchase, ensuring that our clients receive the best possible experience with our products.
   

  

 You'll be working at the intersection of embedded systems and cloud computing, driving the design and development of software that facilitates seamless communication and data transfer between our devices and cloud-based applications. Collaborating closely with your colleagues, you'll define software requirements, craft design specifications, and lead the charge in Rust development within our organization.
   

  

 What sets this role apart is the opportunity to make a significant impact on our development processes and product offerings. You'll have the autonomy to set the framework for Rust development activities and provide guidance to fellow developers, empowering them to excel in their operational tasks.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Design and develop embedded systems software using Rust and related tools, including pipelines, testing, and automation.
* Collaborate with other developers, including hardware engineers, software developers, and cloud engineers, to ensure seamless integration between different layers of the system.


**What You Bring To The Team**
* Solid background in software development, ideally acquired within a product-focused company or scale-up environment
* Commercial experience with Rust and Linux
* Understanding of how IoT and wireless devices can be connected


**Nice to have**
* Experience working with IoT, Bluetooth, and wireless devices
* Experience with Kotlin and Python
* Knowledge of databases (Redis, MongoDB)
* DevOps understanding; maintaining own code (AWS)
* MQTT experience


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Systemutvecklare/ Fullstacksutvecklare
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom systemutveckling baserat på open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är drygt 320 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på sju kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn, Oslo och Trondheim.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Nu utökar vi vårt område specialiserat på systemutveckling och vill hitta fler kollegor som brinner för att arbeta med relevant teknik och leverera mjukvarulösningar I världsklass till våra kunder! Du kommer arbeta i tätt samarbete med kund för att arbeta fram den bästa lösningen på problem och tackla utmaningar med innovativa tekniska lösningar. Vi arbetar med flera branscher där du får ta del av stora enterpriseprojekt till mindre start-ups.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
* Du är en ambitiös engagerad utvecklare/arkitekt med erfarenhet av modern Fullstack-utveckling
* Du tycker om att interagera med kunder, kollegor och användare för att diskuterahur man bäst löser problem och utmaningar med innovativa tekniska lösningar
* Du är noggrann på detaljnivå i både kodning och dokumentation och brinner för Clean Code
* Du är självständig, tar ansvar för att hålla deadlines och leverera högsta kvalitet.


**Kvalifikationer**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är det viktigt att du har ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utvecklas inom nya områden och i ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och förstår att det är samarbete som för oss framåt. Du tycker också att det är viktigt att hjälpa till att skapa en riktigt bra arbetsplats genom att både driva och delta på sociala aktiviteter samt dela med dig av dina kunskaper till kollegor.
   

  

*Utöver ovanstående kompetenser ser vi gärna att du har:*
* Minst 5 års professionell erfarenhet av systemutveckling med Javascript/TypeScript, Java eller liknande – Gärna på ramverk såsom Spring Boot, Node.js, React och Angular
* Kunskaper i Microservices och containerteknik
* Erfarenhet av cloud
* Praktisk erfarenhet av teamarbete (Scrumerfarenhet är ett plus)
* Bekväm med svenska och engelska


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Du får arbeta med spännande projekt i flera olika branscher: allt från startups till globala jättar och myndigheter där du får vara med och göra skillnad på riktigt!
* Du får trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik - våra konsulter är våra superstars och prioriteras alltid först
* Du får arbeta med den senaste tech-stacken och alltid vara up-to-date med ny teknologi
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med fantastisk sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Karlstad Linköping, Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Trondheim with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Commercial Excellence Intern
description:
About the job
*Are you a student within Data Analytics or Business Administration and want to gain experience from a multinational company? By doing an internship with us you have chance to work and learn in a purpose driven and fast-moving international environment. We encourage an entrepreneurial mind-set by giving our employees and interns alike the opportunity to drive growth of strong brands, contribute to a healthier world as well as develop professionally and personally.*

  


***We want to inform you that this is an unpaid internship, and you need to be a student in Sweden within the relevant field & have internship included in your program.***

  


**About the internship/main tasks:**



The Commercial Excellence team is the strategic core of the **Specialized Nutrition** business in the Nordics and Baltics region. We are responsible for setting and driving business excellence, overseeing implementation, and ensuring technological advancement in Sales and Marketing. You will report to Head of SN Commercial Excellence & Value Creation, who is located in Vilnius. You will also have an on-site colleague at the office in Solna.

  



Your responsibilities and learning objectives will include:


* **CRM Management**: You will learn to manage CRM routines, including data extraction/uploading, checking data correctness, and creating supporting documentation.
* **Problem-Solving**: You will gain experience in resolving CRM and database issues, supporting CRM users, and advising them upon request.
* **Technological Advancement**: The intern will pioneer CRM excellence by testing and implementing new CRM additions and modules.
* **Strategic Projects development**: Participate in tech-related projects such as Gigya, Marketing Automation Cloud, and Power BI implementation will provide hands-on experience in these areas.
* **Business Processes facilitation**: The intern will dive deep into business processes, value creation, and work with cross-functional teams to improve efficiency and establish standards across the region.

  


About you
* **Currently pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree Business Administration, Business Management, IT & Data Analytics (or related) in Sweden**
* **Have an internship included in your program for at least 10 weeks during spring 2025**
* Excellent analytical skills and problem-solving skills
* Strong sense of responsibility and ability to meet short deadlines
* Willing to learn and develop in dynamic environment
* **Good oral and written communication skills in English is a must**

About us

Danone’s mission is bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we believe in order to do so we need a healthy planet. We have more than 100 000 employees worldwide who all strive for our vision One Planet One Health.

  



Danone Nordics & Baltics have 500 employees based in Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Norway, Latvia and Lithuania. Our brand portfolio includes many trusted brands such as Alpro, Activia, Actimel, Danonino, Nutricia and Aqua d´Or. Danone Nordics is also proud to be a **B Corp Certificated Company** which means we are doing business in a better way.

  


**HOW TO APPLY**



Click “APPLY” button and send in your application in **English no later than the 6th of December.** The recruitment process is ongoing, and we will review applications and conduct interviews continuously. **Kindly note that the position may be filled before last application date.**

  


*All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability status.*

  


*Danone AB with its registered office in Stockholm (Gårdsvägen 14, 169 70 Solna) is the controller of your personal data disclosed in the profile and in documents submitted during the recruitment process.*

  



#Nordics



#Li-Nordics #LI-NORBAL
company_description: “One planet. One Health by YOU” - these words reflect our vision that the health of people and the health of the planet are interconnected. Join our movement for a healthier world!

title: Data Scientist (Temporary Contract)
description:
**Help us shape the future of mobility**
----------------------------------------

  

  

At Volvo Cars, we’re on an exciting journey to shape the future of mobility. We’re building direct relationships with customers, and aim to be a leader in new technology. It’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. Join us and become a part of our vision for the future – a future that's both exciting and a catalyst for positive change.

  


**What you will do**  

  

As a Data Scientist within the Quality Data Science & Engineering team, you will play a crucial role in developing scalable solutions, standards, and frameworks in detecting, and fault trace, quality related issues. You will act as a bridge between business needs and data-driven solutions, enabling federated teams to leverage shared AI tools and methodologies. Your responsibilities will include analyzing large and complex datasets to identify patterns, trends, and correlations. You will develop and implement advanced statistical models and machine learning algorithms to solve business problems and design experiments to gather data and validate hypotheses.  

Collaboration is key in this role. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to define project objectives and deliver actionable insights. Your ability to interpret and communicate complex findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders will be essential. Additionally, you will stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science and apply best practices to improve our analytical capabilities, ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the data science lifecycle.


Required Skills  

* Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, or engineering.
* Proficiency in Python and SQL.
* Experience with large datasets and data preprocessing.
* Deep understanding of machine learning algorithms.
* Understanding of cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).
* Experience with big data technologies.
* Knowledge of NLP techniques.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Ability to work in cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects.
  

  

Education and Experience  

* Advanced degree preferred.
* 5+ years in machine learning and model building.

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Marcus Percival at Marcus.percival@volvocars.com  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. We’re excited to get to know you!

  

  

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Data Scientist - Safety Research
description:
**Innovation starts with being curious.**

  

  

At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable and convenient mobility. Want to join us?

  


At Volvo Cars Safety Centre, we have around 200 highly skilled professionals who strive every day to make the world a safer place for vehicle occupants, their loved ones, and the people around them. Covering the Safety and Durability attributes, we bravely relentlessly lead the way for safety in and support of the company’s strategic direction: Freedom to move in a personal, sustainable and safe way.  

  

The Data, Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team at Volvo Cars Safety Centre works in large part with real world safety data to understand and explain accident and injury causation mechanisms and, thus, laying foundations for future safety features and functions in upcoming car development programs. We provide our knowledge to our car programmes through data analysis and knowledge needed to help drive the engineering of world leading products. The work is performed in close collaboration with Volvo Cars digital organisation and relevant data analytics organisations that provides us the governance and digital infrastructure for retrieving and analysing real world data.

  

  

**Position and Person Details**
-------------------------------



We are currently looking for a data scientist with excellent software development skills. Your primary focus will be to develop world class data analytics and AI products by applying scientifically established methods and techniques such as statistics, machine learning and deep learning. You shall develop these by following best practices and well accepted design principles in software engineering and machine learning operations (ML/AIOPS). In addition, you may have the opportunity to be involved in developing novel methods in data science with automotive safety as a focus area.  

  

**Main responsibilities**  

* Ability to map a business question to analytical context outlining the choice of methods and analytical subsets of data,
* Pre-processing of structured and unstructured data including cleansing and validating the quality and integrity of data in the analytical context,
* Enhancing data collection procedures to include all relevant information for developing analytic products. Ability to fuse multiple datasets in a given context,
* Implement appropriate statistical, machine learning and/or deep learning methods for appropriate business questions and relevant datasets,
* Develop and deploy data science products in the cloud or on-prem infrastructure,
* Communicate and collaborate with other parts of the company and ensure that best practices are used for designing and documenting solutions.


  

**Required qualifications**  

* University degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., but not limited to – Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Natural Sciences, etc.) or equivalent work experience,
* Previous work experience in writing Ability to write high quality data science code in Python programming language. Proven track record and knowledge of best practices and standards in coding, familiarity with Python-based data processing and analysis libraries,
* Well versed with visualizing the insights in dashboards or similar solutions either off-the-shelf or Python-based frameworks,
* Significant experience in developing end-to-end Data Science software solutions,
* Experience with state-of-the-art data science and ML practices along with advanced knowledge of and experience with Python-based ML and DL libraries (particularly for ML) as well as version control (e.g., git and GitHub),
* Experience in developing scalable ML-based production systems in the cloud using multiple platforms such as Databricks and Azure,
* Familiarity and exposure to large language models and principles of generative AI,
* Fluent in English (written and verbal).


  

**Meritorious competences**  

* Work experience with vehicle safety data and principles,
* Familiarity with ML-ops and cloud environments at Volvo Cars,
* Proven experience with Kubernetes and Docker,
* Knowledge of and interest in data engineering aspects and data pipelines
* Experience working with large scale text processing, classification and analysis methods.


  

**Personal qualities**  

* Passion for data science and analysis,
* Structured way of working, and good documentation skills,
* A self-driven and result oriented team player,
* Willingness to learn and improve.

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
--------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.

  


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter John Rose at john.rose@volvocars.com.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 26th of November, 2024. We’re excited to get to know you!

  


**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!

title: EMEA SUP Marketing mgr (12 months FTC), AWS EMEA Marketing
description:
Experience in professional non-internship marketing
  
Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements
  
Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables)
  
Experience building and optimizing multiple, simultaneous marketing campaigns
  
Experience managing or working within cross-functional marketing and creative teams
  
  

Amazon Web Services is seeking a talented, self-directed field marketing expert to lead our segment, industry and category marketing teams across EMEA. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in an exciting, fast growing business.
  
  

This is a 12 months Fixed Term Contract role.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
  
  

As the EMEA SUP Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing a deep understanding of the Startup (SUP) customer audience and their needs, developing a scalable marketing strategy to address them. This audience contains early-stage as well as more matured startup companies, and encompass both technical and business decision-makers. Your remit will include understanding our business strategy, understanding customer needs, building a targeting framework, defining the proposition, program planning, campaign/messaging development and coordinating execution across our EMEA field marketing teams to deliver results.
  
You will partner closely with the AWS EMEA marketing leadership team, and be responsible for working with field sales and marketing teams in countries, as well as with corporate teams in the US, to deliver programs that drive awareness, service adoption and leads. The right candidate will have successful experience in results-driven marketing and partnering with sales teams to drive growth in new regions, as well as an unbridled passion for technology, and an entrepreneurial spirit.
  
  

About the team
  
Diverse Experiences
  
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Why AWS?
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship & Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

Experience in multi-territory campaign management
  
Experience in digital marketing and content production timelines and process
  
  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Nattreceptionist Scandic No 25
description:
Scandic no 25, eller 25:an som vi brukar kallas, ligger precis vid Göteborgs centralstation med goda kommunikationer. Hotellet är personligt och hemtrevligt snarare än stort och pampigt. Det personliga formatet återspeglas också i stämningen bland oss som jobbar här- vi har en stark sammanhållning och hjälper varandra så ofta vi kan. Vi är måna om att ge våra medarbetare möjlighet att utvecklas, det leder också till fantastisk service och därmed fantatiskt nöjda gäster.


**Nu söker vi en Nattreceptionist till Scandic No 25.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.



Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerheten på hotellet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och den här tjänsten innebär nattarbete, ca 22-07, 7 dagar i rad, för att sedan ha 7 dagar ledigt.


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster och ta ett stort ansvar för våra gästers säkerhet.


Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Vi ser helst erfarenhet av tidigare arbete nattetid och inom reception på hotell.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid.



Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_addresses:
Scandic Hotels Deutschland GmbH
Gabriele-Tergit-Promenade 19
10963 Berlin

Scandic Borlänge är ett familjärt hotell mitt i city, nära centralstationen och shoppingen på Norra Backa. Här kan våra gäster njuta av god mat i vår restaurang, varva ner i vår inomhuspool eller bara umgås i vår lobby. På hotellet lägger vi stor vikt vid att erbjuda våra medarbetare en bra arbetsmiljö – ett gott ledarskap i en varm och familjär atmosfär. Vi tar inte bara väl hand om våra gäster, vi tar alltid hand om varandra. title: Junior Account Manager (gn) Located in Barcelona - Digital Sales (Swedish Speaking)
description:
Job Function: Sales The role: **Junior Account Manager (gn) - Digital Sales****(Swedish Speaker)** **Full-time | permanent | Location: Barcelona** **Exciting News!** We are happy to announce that SoftwareOne **is creating a new Digital Sales Hub for EMEA in Barcelona!**

Are you eager to launch your career in digital sales and make an impact in a growing tech company? At SoftwareOne, we are looking for enthusiastic individuals with a passion for sales and technology, to join our team as **Junior Account Manager for our Sales Hub in Barcelona.** If you have at least 2 years of experience in sales, preferably in B2B, strong communication skills in Swedish and English, and a drive to excel, we want to hear from you!

**The Role:**


As a Junior Account Manager, you will be the main point of contact for our SME clients, managing relationships and ensuring exceptional service delivery. Your focus will be on driving sales, understanding software requirements, assisting with renewals, managing escalations, and maintaining coverage across all assigned accounts. You will play a crucial role in building trust-based relationships, ensuring client satisfaction, and spotting opportunities for growth.

**Relationship Management:** Build and maintain strong, trust-based relationships with SME clients, understanding their needs and goals.* **Service Delivery:** Act as the primary contact for digital service inquiries, coordinating with internal teams to meet client needs.
* **Renewal Strategy:** Develop and execute renewal strategies tailored to each client, leading negotiations to secure contract renewals.
* **Escalation Resolution:** Address and resolve post-sales issues, collaborating with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot problems.
* **Account Coverage:** Maintain a comprehensive understanding of clients' business landscapes, identifying opportunities for growth.
* **Data-driven Sales:** Utilize data insights and market intelligence to drive sales motions, identify upsell opportunities, and execute targeted sales campaigns.
* **Performance Analysis:** Monitor and analyze performance metrics to improve account management processes and sales strategies.
* **Client Advocacy:** Represent client interests within the organization, championing client success stories to drive referrals and testimonials.


What we need to see from you:
* + **Educational Background:** A degree in commerce or related fields is a plus, but not required.
	+ **Experience:** At least two years of sales experience, preferably in B2B.
	+ **Ability to Learn:** Capable of learning IT topics and having good business acumen.
	+ **Passion for Sales:** Enthusiastic about sales and committed to achieving excellence in customer satisfaction.
	+ **Strong Communication and Negotiation Skills:** Ability to communicate clearly, take initiative, and persuade effectively.
	+ **Interest in Technology:** A keen interest in technology products and services, and a strong desire to learn more about IT.
	+ **Mindset:** A growth mindset with a continuous desire to learn and improve, openness to feedback, team spirit, and innovative thinking.
	+ **Language Proficiency:** Ability to communicate effectively in Swedish and English.
	+ **Join the IT Industry:** A unique opportunity to enter the fast-growing IT sector with comprehensive support.
	+ **Top-Tier Training:** Access to exceptional training programs, including digital learning, elite mentorship, and hands-on training during your onboarding.
	+ **Certifications and Mentors:** Receive valuable certifications and guidance from experienced mentors to enhance your skills and career prospects.
	+ **Flexible Model:** Flexible working hours, hybrid work model, and reduced workdays on Fridays and during the summer.
	+ **Dynamic Work Environment:** A collaborative atmosphere where you can thrive and grow.
	+ **Professional Growth:** Opportunities for development and career advancement.
	+ **Competitive Compensation:** Attractive salary and benefits package.
	+ **Join Our New Sales Hub:** Be part of a vibrant team in our new Barcelona office.**Join us in this vibrant city and be part of our dynamic growth journey!**

  


Why SoftwareOne?:

SoftwareOne is a leading global software and cloud solutions provider that is redefining how organizations build, buy, and manage everything in the cloud. By helping clients to migrate and modernize their workloads and applications – and in parallel, to navigate and optimize the resulting software and cloud changes – SoftwareOne unlocks the value of technology. The company’s 9,200 employees are driven to deliver a portfolio of 7,500 software brands with sales and delivery capabilities in ninety countries.
Accommodations:

SoftwareOne welcomes applicants from all backgrounds and abilities to apply. If you require reasonable adjustments at any point during the recruitment process, email us at reasonable.accommodations@softwareone.com.
Please include the role for which you are applying and your country location. Someone from our organization that is not part of the decision-making process will be in touch to discuss your specific needs and we will make every effort to accommodate you. Any information shared will be stored securely and treated in the strictest of confidence in line with GDPR.  

At SoftwareOne, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Additionally, we encourage experienced individuals that have taken an intentional career break and are now prepared to return to work to explore our SOAR program.

title: Partner & Alliance Manager Nordics
description:
Benify is a globally recognized HR tech company dedicated to delivering top-notch benefits through its rewards platform. With an internationally diverse team of 500+ Benifyers across 6 countries, we are successfully collaborating with around 1500 customers and meeting the needs of close to two million users worldwide . Our mission is all about empowering individuals, supporting them to realize their full potential while promoting an engaging and sustainable work atmosphere where everyone is included and valued - "Because People Matter" . Are you a dynamic professional with a proven track record in partner sales and an interest in understanding customers' needs? Then we have an exciting opportunity for a qualified individual to focus on our Nordic market as an Partner & Alliance Manager at our Stockholm HQ Office. As our Partner & Alliance Manager for the Nordics, you will be responsible for building and managing strategic partnerships that drive growth and expand our market presence. This role involves identifying new opportunities, managing partner relationships, and collaborating closely with Benify’s sales and product teams to enhance our go-to-market strategies. You will be instrumental in increasing Benify’s reach in the Nordics by developing strong relationships and effective sales channels, working directly with Nordic leadership to achieve our strategic objectives.
  
Here is your chance to become part of our innovative and dynamic team that continues to grow!In this role you will:
  
  

Identify and onboard new channel partners to expand Benify’s reach, ensuring smooth integration and success.
  
  

Manage the full sales cycle from prospecting to contract setup, developing go-to-market strategies aligned with Benify’s goals.
  
  

Collaborate closely with the sales team to capitalize on partnership-driven opportunities and enhance sales performance.
  
  

Build and maintain strong partner relationships, providing ongoing support, contract management, and strategic guidance.
  
  

Stay informed on industry trends to advise partners, resolve issues, and drive competitive advantage across the Nordics.
  
  

Leverage regional insights and travel frequently to strengthen partnerships, driving growth in the Nordic market.
  
Who are You?
  
  

You are a proactive and strategic individual with a passion for partnership development and sales. You have a proven ability to navigate complex negotiations, understand market dynamics, and build relationships that drive long-term success.You are curious and embrace creative thinking, employ multi-channel communication, and use data-driven strategies to think innovatively.Your strong problem-solving mindset, coupled with a results-oriented approach, is key.Requirements to succeed in the role
  
Minimum of 5 years in a similar role, ideally within the SaaS industr
  
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Marketing, or a related field
  
Strong skills in negotiation, relationship-building, and strategic thinking
  
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
  
Familiarity with IT and Cloud solutions and experience in go-to-market strategies with partners is highly beneficial
  
Fluency in both Swedish/Danish and English
  
  

Perks of being a Benifyer
  
Generous wellness allowance or health budget
  
30 days vacation
  
Pension
  
Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid work model
  
Annual conference and a variety of social events and activities at our offices
  
Workation - possibility to work abroad within EU .
  
  

If you want to know more about what it's like to work at Benify, please check out our careers page here.
  
**Practical InformationStart:** The search for the perfect fit starts now!Extent: Full-time, 100%Location: Stockholm
  
We encourage you to apply by submitting your CV and/or LinkedIn profile using the application form below. Constant application screening implies our search may end before the last application date, so hurry!
  
We are an equal opportunity employer and are happy to accommodate any reasonable adjustments necessary to help you during the interview process.

title: Sales Manager Public 360 - Tietoevry Industry
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
Sales Manager - Plan & Build 360° (Nordic)
Join us in shaping the future of public sector digitalization in the Nordics!
We are looking for an ambitious and strategic Sales Manager to drive the growth of our P360° Plan & Build solution across the Nordic market. This solution is specifically designed to streamline the processing of building applications for municipalities, playing a vital role in public sector modernization.
In this role, you will lead the go-to-market strategy for Plan & Build 360°, tailoring our value proposition and defining unique selling points for each Nordic market. If you have a passion for sales, an innate ability to connect with customers, and the drive to take ownership of sales opportunities from start to finish, we want to hear from you!  

About Public 360°  

Our mission with Public 360° is to be the leading platform for public sector digitalization across the Nordics. Public 360° is a standardized solution that supports national archiving and case management standards, enabling efficient resident services and digitized case management. The platform’s automation capabilities allow customers to increase efficiency and quality, making Public 360° an essential tool for public sector transformation.  

Key Responsibilities* Expand Plan & Build 360°: Spearhead the implementation and growth of our Plan & Build solution across Nordic markets.
* Develop Market Strategy: Create and execute tailored go-to-market strategies and sales plans for each country, positioning Public 360° as the preferred choice in public sector digitalization.
* Drive Sales and Customer Engagement: Lead and proactively manage sales cases, collaborating closely with customers to understand and meet their needs.
* Lead in Tenders and Bids: Provide essential support for Plan & Build 360° tenders, ensuring our solutions align with local requirements and meet the needs of municipalities.
* Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with product teams, marketing, and other Tietoevry units to align efforts and optimize results.
* Market Communication and Branding: Actively support marketing initiatives and contribute to positioning Public 360° as a market leader.

  


What We’re Looking For* Proven Sales Success: A background in product sales, preferably with experience in selling to public sector clients.
* Public Sector Expertise: A strong understanding of the municipal building application process and related regulations.
* Team Leadership: Demonstrated ability to foster a positive team spirit and encourage collaboration toward shared goals.
* Interpersonal Skills: Natural team player with excellent communication skills, easily building relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
* Relevant Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Information Science, Economics, or a related field.
* Language Skills: Proficiency in English is essential, as this is our working language. Proficiency in Norwegian, Swedish, Danish, or Finnish is also an advantage

  

Why Join Us?
This role offers an exciting opportunity to work at the forefront of digital transformation for the public sector. As part of our talented team, you’ll have the chance to shape and drive the future of municipal services in the Nordics. We offer a dynamic and collaborative work environment with opportunities for growth, innovation, and making a meaningful impact.  

Ready to make a difference in public sector digitalization? Apply today and help us lead the way with Public 360°!
If you have any questions, please contact Sales Director, Katarina Steen on katarina.steen@tietoevry.com, or Talent Acquisition Lead, Rojin Amini, rojin.amini@tietoevry.com.  

  

*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*  

*Tietoevry thrives with diversity, and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.*  

  

About Tietoevry  

Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.  

  

Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do  

  

Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: SAP Defence Consultant
description:
Accentures svenska SAP-affärsområde


Som marknadsledande affärspartner sedan över 40 år tillbaka arbetar vi med SAP end-to-end, med allt från produktinnovation till utveckling och leverans. Vi driver flera stora SAP-transformationsprojekt med några av de största företagen i Norden. Inom vårt nordiska SAP-community arbetar vi med de senaste SAP-lösningarna och tjänsterna såsom SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP D&S, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP och SAP RISE.

  

Accenture är ledande på marknaden med teknologisk och funktionell expertis inom områden som finans, logistik, inköp, HR och data analytics inom flertalet industrier inklusive Försvarssektorn. Vi har ett starkt hållbarhetsfokus och hjälper kunder att definiera och möjliggöra hållbarhetsstrategier samtidigt som vi skapar affärsvärden för kunden.

  

Rollen


Vi expanderar just nu vår svenska SAP-community och letar efter erfarna SAP-konsulter inom finans, logistik, HR och teknologi för olika positioner inom försvarssektorn i Sverige.


Du kommer att få en unik möjlighet att delta i projekt som är avgörande för våra kunders framgång inom den dynamiska försvarssektorn.


Övergripande ansvarsområden

* Hantering av system-incidenter, test, support, utbildning och dokumentation inom respektive område Transport, Lagerhållning, Materialplanering, Inventering och/eller utlåning av personlig och funktionell utrustning
* Analys och felsökning samt rättning
* Genomföra kontinuerlig förbättring av processer och arbetsmetoder i systemet
* Analys av hur olika förändringar påverkar övriga processer
* Stöd och genomföra olika tester och dokumentera föreslagna samt genomförda process- och systemförändringar

  

Kvalifikationer

* Erfarenhet av SAP inom finans, logistik, HR, Inköp, Teknologi företrädesvis med internationella teknikföretag eller slutanvändarkunder inom Försvarssektorn eller relaterade industrier
* God förståelse för processer som täcker de ovan nämnda områdena
* En kandidat- eller magisterexamen
* Bosatt i Sverige, eller villig att flytta till Sverige (inom EU)
* Svenska språkkunskaper i tal och skrift


Varför välja Accenture?


Bli en del av Accenture och anslut dig till ett passionerat team som är dedikerat till teknik, innovation och personlig utveckling. Vi är ledande inom SAP-innovation inom försvarssektorn och gör en positiv skillnad inom industrin även globalt.

* Karriärmöjligheter: Få tillgång till omfattande möjligheter för karriärutveckling med utbildning, certifieringar och en tydlig väg för framsteg.
* Inkluderande kultur: Bli en del av ett samarbetsvilligt team med stor mångfald i en arbetsmiljö som värderar din insats och välmående.
* Cutting-Edge Resources: Få tillgång till den senaste teknologin och verktygen för att utmärka dig inom försvarsområde och arbeta med innovativa projekt.


Om du är redo att ansluta dig till vårt dynamiska team och bidra till SAP-världen inom försvarssektorn, ser vi fram emot din ansökan för din önskade position. Skicka in ditt CV och ett personligt brev där du beskriver din relevanta erfarenhet och kvalifikationer. Delta i att forma framtidens affärer genom SAP-innovation och gör en positiv inverkan inom försvarssektorn. För mer information om vår SAP-praxis, besök oss på https://www.accenture.com/se-en/services/sap-index.


Plats


Stockholm, Mälardalen

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
### **Ready for a new adventure building the next-generation retail experience?**


As an Analytics Engineer at Bambuser, you’ll be an integral part of our data team. You will focus on building scalable analytics workflows, maintaining and developing key dashboards, and solving complex analytical problems in a scalable manner. You’ll take part in driving our analytics strategy, ensuring data quality and availability across the business. In this role, you will have a visible impact by creating data products that directly influence the business, customers, and product insights.

**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

* Build and maintain analytics tables to ensure data is easily accessible and actionable.
* Develop and maintain key dashboards in ThoughtSpot and other BI tools to serve key business insights to internal teams.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineering, Product, and Customer Success Management (CSM), to deliver actionable insights.
* Solve complex analytical challenges and provide scalable, high-quality data solutions (ie: attribution modeling).
* Contribute to the development of Bambuser's data strategy, including the improvement of our "golden data sets" and other key initiatives.
* Drive improvements in data quality and availability, helping the company make data-driven decisions.
* Build and optimize data products exposed to our customers, impacting their experience and success.

**Technical Skills & Requirements**
-----------------------------------

* Proficient in SQL and familiar with transformation tools such as Dataform or dbt.
* Experience with Python, or similar, and an understanding of cloud platforms, particularly GCP (Google Cloud Platform), is a plus.
* Familiarity with event-driven architectures.
* Experience with BI tools (e.g., ThoughtSpot, Looker) and a desire to create meaningful, visually appealing insights.

**Business and Soft Skills**
----------------------------

* High stakeholder engagement: You will regularly interface with both technical and non-technical teams across the business.
* Familiarity with e-commerce or streaming data in an event-driven architecture is a plus.
* Strong communication skills with an ability to explain technical solutions to non-technical audiences.

**Experience**
--------------

* Mid-level to senior experience, with a proven track record in analytics engineering, data warehousing, or a similar role.
* Experience with GCP (BigQuery, Dataflow) is preferred but not required.

**Opportunities for Growth**
----------------------------

* Gain exposure to the entire data architecture at Bambuser, with opportunities to contribute across the stack.
* Play a key role in developing Bambuser's future data products and strategy.
* Collaborate closely with the Head of Data and product teams to build cutting-edge data solutions.
* Opportunities to take on leadership in data initiatives and scale insights across the company.

#### **This is Bambuser**


Bambuser’s Video Commerce technology drives customer engagement and sales for some of the world’s largest brands and retailers. At the forefront of live streaming technology since 2007, Bambuser launched interactive eCommerce solutions in 2019 and quickly became the platform of choice for companies worldwide. Our team has established long-term partnerships and supported campaign activations for brands and retailers including Adidas, Hugo Boss, brands within the LVMH group, Clarins, Selfridges, Sonos, and many others.

 *Bambuser values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds, regardless of where you come from or what you believe.*

title: Commercial Product Manager B2B Mobile Networks
description:
* Application Deadline: Dec. 1, 2024
* Kista
* Hybrid
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

  

*If you are passionate to grow and evolve businesses combined with a strong belief that 5G will be a pivotal enabler for private and public enterprises, look this way. As the Commercial Product Manager for Tele2 B2B Mobile Networks, you will be part of a team of highly skilled professionals on a quest to maximize customer value, based on our services, and financial growth. Sounds interesting? Please read on.*  

  

**About the job**  

At Tele2 B2B (Business to business), we work every day to enable a society of unlimited possibilities through our broad portfolio of IT- and Telecom related Products and Services. With a team of knowledgeable experts, we help Private and Public customers to digitalize and secure their business potential. We are now looking for a new member to join our successful team and contribute to our growth, superior customer experience and high employee engagement.  

  

*Purpose of the function*  

Tele2 B2B Mobile Networks is responsible for 4G and 5G Network solutions specifically designed for Tele2 B2B customers with the anticipation to grow even further in importance coming years along the evolution of 5G capabilities.


As a Commercial Product Manager within Tele2 B2B organization, you will have the mandate, in close cooperation with other units within B2B organization, to excel the portfolio for 4G and 5G Mobile Network services to Tele2 B2B customers. Your main contribution and responsibilities are;


* Own and maximize P&L performance of the Tele2 B2B Mobile Networks portfolio
* Own, develop and optimize the portfolio for Tele2 B2B Mobile Networks portfolio
* Champion business growth and excellence through innovation in new services, business models and proposition design
* Improve Tele2’s position on the market for B2B Mobile Networks portfolio


*Key Responsibilities in the role include*


* P&L management, including budget, forecasting and follow-up for Tele2 B2B Mobile Networks portfolio
* Evolve and establish a strong market position for Tele2 B2B Mobile Networks portfolio services through own capabilities and selected partnerships
* Champion and lead Tele2 B2B innovation journey, based on new network capabilities, towards 5G monetization
* Business steering and prioritization for Tele2 B2B Mobile Networks portfolio
* Ownership of commercial product strategy development and detailing into roadmap execution
* Ownership of the business framework for Tele2 B2B Mobile Networks portfolio with focus on agreements, business rules, partnerships and business models
* Business casing and commercial/financial decision making



The preferred position is located in our headquarter in Kista, Stockholm and we offer a hybrid workplace.


**Who are you?**  

To thrive and succeed in this role we believe that you have:

  

* Strong commercial experience within Telecom sector with focus on market positioning, partnerships and business development
* Strong experience in driving innovation and new service development cross several functional areas
* Strong business acumen with excellence in understanding revenue & cost dynamics in a complex business
* Strong product development skills with ability to take a business idea into a commercial product
* Technical understanding in the domain of Mobile Networks (4G and 5G)
* Proven track record of leading innovation that has generated tangible value for consumers
* Strong leadership and team-player capabilities, with excellent communication skills, to efficiently collaborate in a cross-functional environment


Nice to haves:

  

* High proficiency in quantitative tools, such as Microsoft Excel
* Ability to compile presentations for diverse set of stakeholders and higher management teams

  

*Who we think you are as a person?*  

We believe you are an individual with strong ambition to make a change. You are probably a forward thinker updated on the latest trends and market needs. In addition, you are a team player, business savvy and detailed oriented, all complemented with a drive to change the status quo and improve on past performances. You can present and communicate innovative ideas and complex matters in a way all types of stakeholders understand.


**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


* Pension and health care
* Hybrid and flexible work life balance
* Career opportunities
* Parental benefit
* Employee benefits and Tele2 discounts
* Inclusive workplace
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------


**A few words from the manager Andreas Dahlqvist, Head of B2B UC & Hybrid Cloud**



*As the Commercial Product Manager you are the spider in the web for the Tele2 B2B Mobile Networks business. As such, you thrive in a high-paced environment where excellent teamwork, and well-thought-out plans, are key to success. You relish the opportunity to own, expand and improve an already profitable business that enable Swedish companies and organizations to benefit from the power of 4G and 5G network services*


*Both your manager and your managers-manager have held Commercial Product Manager roles in the past. That means you’ll have great support and experience to tap into. It’s also a testament to the career development potential inherent in this role.*

  

**Why Tele2**


* We believe in fostering a creative and flexible work environment. You will be part of a culture where teamwork and inclusion are leading the way forward, a place where you bring your whole self to work as the unique person you are. We are committed to building a company that values diversity in all its forms.
* Every employee is important for the company’s success and you will always have an impact through your work with opportunities for growth and development through internal paths.
At Tele2, we work hard to our commitment to lead in sustainability, which has made us the number one climate leader in Europe and we keep reaching new goals as we are bound to shift to a circular economy.  
* 

**Interest and application**  

Would you like to be a part of the Tele2s value-driven and including culture? Then hit the “apply now” button and let’s find out if we’re a match!


If you have any specific questions regarding the position, please feel free to contact TA specialist: [email protected]



Please note that in compliance with personal data management regulations (GDPR), we are unable to accept CVs via email.


As a step in the recruitment process, Tele2 performs a background check on final candidates.


**Work with great people**
--------------------------


Emma
Digital Capabilities & Technology
*"Everyone at Tele2 always aim for the stars in order to create unlimited possibilities."*
Marika
Head of IT Operational Excellence
*"We’re serious about what we do, and we get things done."*
**About the company**
---------------------


At Tele2 we work hard to fulfill our commitment to lead in sustainability being named the number one climate leader in Europe by The Financial Times and we keep reaching new goals as we are bound to shift to a circular economy.


We take great pride in delivering customer value by being Reliable, Insight Driven and Collaborative. We call it the Tele2 Way.

title: Early Career Program: Industry 4.0 Trainee
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


Our Excellerate Global Leadership Program will give you an outstanding opportunity to engage with commercial projects at a strategic and global level, rising up to challenges and becoming and developing as a leader.


As part of the Excellerate program you are able to seize the initiative, operate with a consultative approach and collaborate on cross-technology solutions. The program will ensure you gain real practical insight into our business, our stakeholders and our customers including communication service providers (CSP) across the globe, and how we integrate end-to-end solutions to ensure everyone worldwide is connected.


Your journey within the Excellerate Program will start as an Industry 4.0 Trainee within Group Supply.

 **What you will do:**


As an Industry 4.0 Trainee, you will be part of an innovative team focused on optimizing and advancing our manufacturing processes through the integration of cutting-edge technologies like 5G, Cloud, advanced data analytics, artificial intelligence and smart systems. This is an exciting opportunity for individuals who are eager to apply their expertise in data-driven solutions to improve operational efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance productivity in a modern manufacturing environment.

 **You will bring:**


Joining the team will offer you an exciting journey through business and technology where you will learn, be able to challenge, take decisions and most importantly have a lot of fun! We believe you can challenge us in who we're looking for and believe you have an interest for business/commercial management combined with a technical interest in the communications industry.

 **In addition, we believe you have:**

* MSc in Data Science, Data Engineering, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
* Strong understanding of data analytics, machine learning, and AI techniques
* Familiarity with smart manufacturing technologies, including IoT, robotics, and automation
* Hands-on programming skills
* A global attitude and willingness to relocate internationally, with a desire and ability to work in a multicultural environment
* Keen interest to learn new things and to broaden experience
* Ability to collaborate, engage with and mobilize the organization to secure results
* Solid presentation and communication skills, and proficiency in English

We can promise you a steep learning curve, exciting tasks and close collaboration as a valued member of a strategically important team. Be the one who did. Find out more about our Early Career program, what the alumni's are up to now and how the program can transform your career at www.ericsson.com/ecp

  



**Why join Ericsson?**


We are a world leader in the constantly evolving environment of communications technology – by providing hardware, software, and services to enable the full value of connectivity. You’ll play a part in using your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what’s possible. To create never-seen-before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. Join a team of innovators driven to go beyond the norm to build what’s next. At Ericsson, you can be an explorer, a change maker and a force for good.
  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


This role will have its first rotation in Kista Stockholm, Sweden. The selection and interview process is ongoing, so send your application in English as soon as it is ready.Vetting including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates. We encourage the opportunity to meet you!


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Req ID:** 756508

**Recruiter:** Monika Nowicka monika.nowicka@ericsson.com


Last day to apply: 22nd November 2024
