* Ensure the solution is proactively delivered through product implementationEnsure to stick to out of the box solution implementation as much as possible and reduce unnecessary customizations


**Qualifications**
* Engineering degree (or equivalent) with proven experience in a Solution Architect role
* Experience with larger scale software implementation with hands-on experience on Agile methodology and working in sprints
* Knowledge and experience of DELMIA Plant Layout / Factory Flow / Process – RME ( recipe) + Simulation (Ergo /Assembly / Robotics)
* An analytical and architectural mindset in combination with an understanding of business processes and value. The ability to present, stand-up for and negotiate your solutions to stakeholders in the customer organization
* Knowledge on Robotics and Automation using 3DEXPERIENCE platform would be a benefit
* Mentor and guide junior developers for solution implementation / development
* Fluent in English and local language


* Flexible to travel


**What’s In It For You**
* An international and diverse working environment in a collaborative team
* Flexible working hours with hybrid working model, a good work-life balance and comprehensive benefits package
* Extensive skills and career development programs to build your journey with us


 Interested? Click on "Apply" to upload your application documents.
   

  

**Diversity statement**
 As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

title: Enterprise Architect - Nordics
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**The position is available for all SAP Locations in the Nordics.**
**About The Team**
 Join our dynamic regional SAP Enterprise Architects team within the new SAP Customer Services & Delivery board. Together with our Architects across the Nordic region, we lead digital transformation using cutting-edge SAP technologies, advancing the RISE with SAP initiative, promoting Clean Core principles, and accelerating SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) adoption. Our mission is to simplify and modernize IT landscapes, reducing complexity and operational costs, while fostering innovation and efficiency to support evolving business needs.
   

  

**YOUR FUTURE ROLE**
 As a Senior Enterprise Architect, You Will Develop a Comprehensive Enterprise Architecture Model For Our Customers Aligning With Their Enterprise Goals, Collaborate With Virtual Account Teams (VAT) As a Transformation Partner And Lead Activities Such As
   

  

* Guide customers through their cloud journey (with special focus on adopt and derive), starting with Enterprise archetypes and scaling digitally.
* Provide enterprise architecture guidance using RISE with SAP methodology and Clean Core principles to ensure that every customer benefits from SAP‘s cloud qualities.
* Act as the Transformation Partner for the CIO or other CxO, driving architecture effectiveness.
* Support adoption, identifying and mitigating technical adoption risks.
* Align customers and partners with SAP’s Clean Core strategy, accelerate BTP adoption and promote SAP best practices.
* Provide customer context to all teams, enhancing customer proximity and experience.
* Articulate the value of the designed target architecture and possible intermediate/ transition steps as well as provide guidance on the realization of the identified benefits
* Serve as a trusted advisor, ensuring secure, reliable, and flexible cloud environments for mission-critical processes.


**YOUR PROFILE**
**Transformation, Architectural & Solution Skills**
* Experience delivering enterprise business transformation projects and aligning customer priorities with target architecture and roadmap.
* Knowledge of the SAP Solution Portfolio and Enterprise Architecture Framework (North Star).
* Experience with Business Technology Platform components (application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, AI) and practical experience with S/4HANA applications.
* Strong understanding of Cloud & Clean Core Strategy, familiarity with SAP LeanIX, Signavio, and Cloud ALM.
* Knowledge of SAP's Business AI roadmap, including identifying use cases and piloting AI-driven solutions to enhance business processes.
* Expertise in SAP Integration and Extensibility Advisory Methodologies.


**Must-Have Requirements**
* 5-15+ years in customer experience roles (e.g., Program Manager, Architect), with experience in end-to-end architectural design for hybrid solution landscapes.
* Knowledge of SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework and Toolset, and experience with BTP components and services such as application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, and AI capabilities.
* S/4HANA technical or/and SAP S/4HANA application/functional knowledge/experience.
* Proficiency in SAP Integration and Extensibility Advisory Methodologies and Clean Core principles.
* Excellent communication, influencing, and negotiation skills (in English and German) at the senior management within an IT team and across business functions.
* Mindset for Strategic Thinking, Continuous Learning, and Business Acumen.


**Nice-to-Have Requirements**
* Knowledge of on-premise and corresponding SAP cloud solutions.
* Professional training and certification (e.g., SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework featured by LeanIX EAM, SAP Certified Professional-Enterprise Architect [P\_SAPEA\_2023], TOGAF) as a plus.


**Bring out your best**
 SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
   

  

**We win with inclusion**
 SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
   

  

 SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com
   

  

 For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.
   

  

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability**
 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
   

  

 Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
   

  

 Requisition ID: 395895 | Work Area: Consulting and Professional Services | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: Virtual - Denmark .

title: Sr. Presales Engineer-Manufacturing
description:
**Sr Presales Engineer- Hybrid**
**Nice to meet you!**
 We’re a leader in data and AI. Through our software and services, we inspire customers around the world to transform data into intelligence - and questions into answers.
   

  

 We’re also a debt-free multi-billion-dollar organization on our path to IPO-readiness. If you're looking for a dynamic, fulfilling career coupled with flexibility and world-class employee experience, you'll find it here.
   

  

**About The Job**
 The Customer Advisory team is looking for an enthusiastic and proactive Sr. Presales Engineer who excels in creating and maintaining close partnerships with customers. Who can drive these partnerships forward with an innovating mindset by creating shared goals to solve complex problems and create value through the deployment of data and analytical solutions. The Custumer Advisory team is expanding the Commercial Sector Business Unit and are seeking an advisor with strong drive, a curious mind and experience of working in the Manufacturing Industry.
   

  

**As a Sr. Presales Engineer , You Will**
* Be an advisor to your clients, providing guidance on how organisations in the Manufacturing Industry can create business value and support their goals using data and deployment of analytical solutions.
* Act as the primary technical contact between the client and SAS, translating client business needs to value-generating solutions based on SAS products (software and cloud) and associated services.
* Define and execute the technical strategy for the manufacturing accounts, working independently from, but in alignment and close partnership with, the account executive and wider engagement team. Potentially, drive and define the overall strategy for the manufacturing sector across the account teams and in collaboration with sales, marketing and wider team.
* Provide technical and pre-sales leadership to new business opportunities, engaging with technical and business audiences – defining and owning the technical engagement plan. Engagements will primarily be with Manufacturing organisations in the Nordics, and potentially UK.
* Be responsible for dealing with complex customer situations using knowledge of industry standards, SAS solutions and the customer’s technology landscape to help deliver win-win outcomes for both the customer and SAS.
* Deliver a high-quality, high-impact customer experience and to demonstrate SAS’ value through presentations, discussions, bids and POC/POVs.
* Use domain (technical and industry) knowledge to create a compelling vision to influence all stakeholders in formal and informal meetings. Adapt assets and presentations to suit the audience including being able to build trust and negotiation objections - internal and external


**Required Qualifications**
* 5 years + experience working in the manufacturing industry.
* Bachelor's degree, preferably in Engineering, Business, Computer Science, or other quantitative field related to area of assignment.
* Equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered in place of the above qualifications.
* Understand the role and relationships of manufacturing value chain functions such as: Inbound Logistics, Operations, Outbound Logistics, Marketing & Sales & Service
* Understand job roles/personas, their responsibilities and relationships in manufacturing processes. E.g. What does Plant Manager, Production Manager, Supply/Demand Planner, Quality Engineer, R&D Engineer, Service Manager etc. do?
* Understand the role and relationships of operational IT systems in industrial automation such as PLC, SCADA, MES, ERP & CRM
* Understand the principles of Industry4.0 framework: how intelligent digital technologies like IoT, Edge Computing, AI, Streaming Data, Digital Twins & Computer Vision are integrated into manufacturing and industrial processes
* Ideally understand and have experience on business solutions that are built around the technologies mentioned above, including ESG Analytics & Reporting, Asset Performance, Production Quality, Field Quality / Aftermarket, Supply Chain Management, Demand Forecasting, Inventory Optimization & Procurement Integrity
* Fluent in one or more Nordic languages and English.
* You’re curious, passionate, authentic and accountable. These are our values and influence everything we do.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Preferably experience in driving software sales opportunities, both as technical lead and managing customer relationships.
* Preferable a basic knowledge on statistics and understand the principles of predictive analytics and machine learning
* A driven individual analytically minded who enjoys challenges and strives for excellence. Able to work proactively both individually and within a team.
* A storyteller with strong verbal, written and presentation skills coupled with analytical and problem-solving abilities and comfortable working at both "C" level and with users.
* A broad mix of technical knowledge, understanding of enterprise architecture with knowledge of architecture standards. Ideally with experience in/around topics such as data management, AI, analytics, fraud detection and intelligence.
* Willingness to travel to client site as required; skills to be hands-on, if necessary, in customer-facing situations; for example - facilitate workshops, gather requirements, and be comfortable delivering software demonstrations as needed.


**Benefits Highlights**
* Our Recreation and Fitness center offers recorded fitness classes to help you fit movement into your day.
* Your well-being matters, and that's why we support all dimensions of your well-being by offering programs that reduce stress and distractions to help you remain healthy and productive.


**Diverse and Inclusive**
 At SAS, it’s not about fitting into our culture – it’s about adding to it. We believe our people make the difference. Our diverse workforce brings together unique talents and inspires teams to create amazing software that reflects the diversity of our users and customers. Our commitment to diversity is a priority to our leadership, all the way up to the top; and it’s essential to who we are. To put it plainly: you are welcome here.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 SAS is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

 SAS only sends emails from verified “sas.com” email addresses and never asks for sensitive, personal information or money. If you have any doubts about the authenticity of any type of communication from, or on behalf of SAS, please contact Recruitingsupport@sas.com.
   

  

 #SAS

title: Associate Solution Consultant – Payroll
description:
*Benify is an international HR tech company that provides a market-leading global benefit and total rewards platform. With over 550 Benifyers in 6 countries, we're driving success with over 1500 customers and approximately three million users around the world* 
 🌍
 *. We empower people to be the best they can be while fostering a sustainable and engaging work culture where employees feel engaged and included
 **"Because People Matter"***
 💙
 *.*
 As an Associate Solution Consultant - Payroll, you’ll be a pivotal player in delivering seamless, high-accuracy payroll reports that fuel our clients' success. With a focus on precision and timeliness, you’ll manage payroll data from start to finish, building trust by ensuring every report is accurate and on time. Working within the Professional Services team, you’ll handle a diverse client portfolio, helping Benify maintain exceptional client satisfaction and retention through your dedication to quality and continuous improvement.
   

  

**In This Role You Will**
* Take end-to-end ownership of client reporting tasks, ensuring timely and accurate reporting that aligns with our service level agreements
* Validate, process, and deliver high-quality reports to clients
* Initiate and lead efforts to eliminate manual steps, driving efficiency and scalability
* Create and maintain the automated reporting schedule and make sure documentation for all processes are accurate and up to date
* Act as the main operational liaison for reporting, addressing client requests and troubleshooting as needed
* Work closely with Client Success Managers on payroll-impacting changes, attending and participating in client meetings and calls as needed
* Support on ad – hoc tasks, working with the broader Professional Services Team


**As An Associate Solution Consultant – Payroll You Will Also**
* Receive and execute payroll tasks from project teams, embedding industry best practices and following all quality assurance processes
* Engage in process enhancement, learning from incidents, and embedding new efficiencies that strengthen our organization


**Personal attributes**
 As an integral member of our organization, you are expected to align with our mission, collaborate effectively within the team, and consistently deliver high-quality results. You should bring a
 **logical and solution-focused mindset** 
 and demonstrate a commitment to
 **accuracy** 
 . Strong
 **problem-solving skills** 
 are key, allowing you to effectively address client challenges. Ensuring their needs are met with tailored solutions.
   

  

**We also see that you have**
* Relevant higher education or at least 2-3 years of experience in an administrative back-office role with a customer focus, such as administrator, order administrator, payroll administrator, finance assistant or technical support.
* Strong analytical skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex reporting issues.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders as well as clients.
* English as a minimum as it’s our corporate language.


**It's an extra** 
**⭐ if you also have...**
* Experience using Excel
* Experience using JIRA


**Practical information**
**Start:** 
 As soon as we find the right match! 🧐
   

  

**Extent:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

*If you would like to read about what it's like to work at Benify, please check out our careers page* 
*here.*
 Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date.
   

  

*Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.*
 Benify started in 2004 in Sweden with a goal to revolutionize the HR industry with a platform that would improve the lives of employees. Today, Benify is an independent, flexible, and agile global HR technology company, offering the market’s leading global benefits and total rewards platform.

title: Systemansvarig & Kategorikoordinator till Reitan Convenience Sweden AB
Supporttekniker till sektionen Helpdesk
description:
På Arbetsmiljöverket jobbar vi tillsammans för att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet. Därför hjälper vi arbetsgivare att uppfylla de krav som finns och informerar om hur arbetsmiljöarbetet blir en naturlig del av vardagen. Med arbetsmiljölagen som grund tar vi fram regler, inspekterar arbetsplatser och sprider kunskap om arbetsmiljöfrågor. Uppdraget är allvarligt men vår vardag präglas av arbetsglädje och vi är omtänksamma och hjälpsamma kollegor.
   

  

**Ditt nya jobb**
 Vill du vara med och utveckla myndigheten som arbetar med frågor som gör skillnad för hela arbetsmarknaden? Är du en engagerad person med flerårig erfarenhet av IT-support och som gillar att ta ansvar och trivs bra med att samarbeta med andra? Då är vi nyfikna på att få veta mer om dig!
   

  

 I januari 2024 genomförde vi en omorganisation av IT-enheten och nu är det dags att rekrytera supporttekniker till sektionen Helpdesk. IT enheten består av tre sektioner, varav helpdesk består av sju supporttekniker. Du kommer att rapportera direkt till sektionschefen för Helpdesk.
   

  

 Som supporttekniker kommer du att vara ett viktigt stöd i IT-supportfrågor för att säkerställa att myndighetens medarbetare har de bästa möjliga förutsättningarna att utföra sina uppdrag. Detta innebär genomföra kunskapshöjande utbildningar, ta fram utbildningsunderlag och kunskapsartiklar. Vidare deltar du i olika projekt och initiativ såsom livscykelhanteringar och systemutbyten. Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med IT teknikerna för att lösa 1:a, 2:a och 3:e linjens support. Alla medarbetare använder bärbara datorer med Windows 11 och iPhone.
   

  

 Dina blivande kollegor på enheten är generösa med att dela med sig av sina kunskaper och tycker att det är viktigt att ha roligt på jobbet. Du arbetar i ett engagerat team med hög kompetens.
   

  

 Hos oss får du utrymme att påverka och utveckla både verksamheten och dina personliga kompetenser, vilket är viktigt för oss. Vidare får du även bidra till att utveckla arbetsprocesser och ditt medarbetarskap.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Rollen kräver att du har:
   

  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inriktning IT eller motsvarande som arbetsgivaren anser är likvärdig.
* Flerårig aktuell erfarenhet av att hjälpa medarbetare med IT-support både på plats och via telefon/distans
* goda kunskaper och erfarenhet av att ge support i Windows 10/11
* goda kunskaper och erfarenhet av att ge support i MS Office, från version 2016 eller senare
* Teknisk kompetens och erfarenhet av att felsöka datorer och kringutrustning
* flerårig erfarenhet av att jobba i ärendehanteringssystem
* mycket bra förmåga att uttrycka sig på svenska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av att:
   

  

* ge support av videosystem t.ex. Skype, Teams, Cisco Meeting eller liknande
* utbilda användare enskilt eller i grupp, skriva lathundar och dokumentation
* jobba med MDM/EMM system
* ge support på iOS enheter
* arbeta med IT support inom myndighet


 Som person ser vi att du kommer att trivas och lyckas i rollen om du är samarbetsorienterad, serviceinriktad och kommunikativ. Dessa egenskaper är avgörande för att effektivt kunna lösa våra supportärenden. Dessutom är det viktigt att du snabbt kan anpassa dig till olika situationer och har en god självkännedom. Detta hjälper både dig och teamet att utvecklas genom att identifiera era styrkor och svagheter, vilket du bör besitta förmågan att kunna influera till. Vid urvalet kommer vi att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära att befattningen placeras i säkerhetsklass. Säkerhetsprövning med eller utan registerkontroll kan därför komma att göras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning genomförs enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Arbetsmiljöverket är en trygg arbetsgivare och en myndighet som hela tiden förändras med samhället vi verkar i. Vi är stolta över att få använda vår kunskap och vårt förtroende i vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande kultur, som rymmer hjärta, mod och hjärna. Hos oss blir hela du en viktig del i något större.
   

  

 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning, på heltid och är för närvarande placerad på vårt kontor i Solna. Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning och provanställning på sex månader.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter att alla medarbetare ska ha en hållbar arbetsmiljö och en balans mellan jobb och fritid. Därför har vi flexibla arbetstider eller tillämpar förtroendearbetstid och ger möjlighet till distansarbete där verksamheten så tillåter.
   

  

 Om oss och våra förmåner och villkor
   

  

**Så rekryterar vi**
 Vi använder kompetensbaserad rekrytering, både för att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringen och för att motverka diskriminering. Vi ber dig därför att endast bifoga ett CV, och svara på några frågor istället för ett personligt brev när du registrerar din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi tycker att det är viktigt att även du får göra din bedömning av oss. Därför välkomnar vi frågor före såväl som under rekryteringsprocessen. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Adam Jansson för Saco, Marita Jonsson för ST samt Jenny Bengtsson för Seko. Samtliga nås via Arbetsmiljöverkets växel: 010-730 90 00.
   

  

 Vill du jobba tillsammans med oss för att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet?
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 18 november 2024!
   

  

 Rekryteringen sköts av Arbetsmiljöverkets rekryteringsfunktion varför vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag eller annonssäljare.

title: Master’s Thesis at KPMG Cyber
description:
*Are you interested in being mentored by Cyber Security consultants within your research field, and develop skills that will help you write a master thesis with interesting insights? KPMG Cyber Security offers students an opportunity to write their master thesis at our Stockholm office this spring.*
**Writing your master thesis at KPMG Cyber is an excellent way to broaden your knowledge within Cyber and get to know the consulting profession. You will be assigned an experienced consultant with knowledge in your industry of interest, who will be your personal advisor from the beginning of your thesis process to the** 
**end of your thesis defense.**
**KPMG Cyber Security** 
 :
   

  

 As a Cyber Security consultant at KPMG, you will be part of a global team working across various industries and areas, collaborating with inspiring colleagues and experts in the field. We work shoulder to shoulder with top executives, advising them on how to tackle their security challenges in an efficient and ethical way.
   

  

 We support our clients in everything from establishing a cyber security strategy to implementing and ensuring compliance with requirements. Our services cover governance issues, operational technology and incident management.
   

  

 By joining our team, you will become a part of a tight knit group of approximately 45 professionals from diverse backgrounds, including computer science, political science, law, law enforcement, criminology, human resources and many more. The diversity enriches our team, enabling us to approach cyber security challenges from multiple perspectives and develop comprehensive solutions. Our team consists of experts within cyber security areas such as ISMS, IAM, cyber defense and response, privacy, cloud security and other cyber related competencies.
   

  

 Read more about our services at our website: Risk Consulting
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Our master thesis program is a one-semester opportunity that starts in January. During the master thesis period at KPMG Cyber Security, your assigned advisor will challenge your thought process and provide insights into your problems and solutions. Furthermore, you will get a great chance to build a network within KPMG. As part of our master thesis program, you will also be invited to several social activities with the team!
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Join us**
 We are looking for high performing and talented individuals who are planning to graduate in the first half of 2025 from relevant fields e.g., IT, engineering, information security, law etc. We require fluency in English and Swedish.
   

  

 As we are a diverse team with different backgrounds, we are always interested in exploring how cyber security and information security can be applied across different industries. Therefore, we encourage you to propose thesis topics that align with your personal area of interest.
   

  

 In the past, master’s students writing their thesis at KPMG Cyber Security have explored topics such as ISMS assessment and implementation, NIS2-directive and other cyber security regulations, IAM solutions and strategies, AI and privacy, approaches for enhancing organizational security practices, and governance frameworks for cybersecurity.
   

  

 Apply no later than 16th of November. Please attach your CV and 2-3 suggestions of master thesis topics. Please note that if you wish to write in a pair or group, everyone must apply separately. Our consultants are based in Stockholm and the master thesis work will be done partly at our office, partly remote. The program will start in January 2025.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact Cassandra Järnberg, Cassandra.jarnberg@kpmg.se or Erik Widman, erik.widman@kpmg.se
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**
 KPMG Cyber Security

title: Demand Generation Manager
description:
**At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small businesses to the world’s most recognizable brands such as Netflix, Redbull and BBC - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.**
 We are now looking for a
 **Demand Generation Manager** 
 to join our scale-up environment. If you're an experienced Demand Generation Manager with over 7 years of experience in marketing, particularly in Enterprise/B2B, and possess strong analytical skills - keep reading!
   

  

**Job Summary:**
 As the Demand Generation Manager at Epidemic Sound, you will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing strategies to nurture, educate and generate leads and/or revenue for Epidemic Sound. You will work closely with the global marketing, product and analytical teams to align efforts and technical infrastructure, enabling the measurement and optimization of performance on a global scale.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute global multi-channel campaigns with a strong focus on utilizing and maximizing the Marketing Cloud Account Engagement (MCAE/Pardot) platform. (Salesforce marketing tools, email, media, sales engagement materials) to drive leads and sales pipeline
* Lead the development and execution of multi-channel campaigns, including lead nurturing, lead scoring, marketing automations strategies, segmentation, and personalized content delivery, to drive prospect engagement and conversion
* Manage external relationships with 3rd party vendors like Salesforce
* Leverage unique differentiation in positioning and messaging by Ideal Customer Profiles (ICP)
* Assist in B2B content development for targeting consumers throughout the customer lifecycle
* Collaborate with sales to develop and implement ABM programs for high-value accounts, ensuring alignment between marketing and sales efforts
* Lead A/B testing strategies and execution across channels (ABM/CRM, digital, content marketing)
* Effectively manage time and resources to deliver high-impact campaigns within tight deadlines.


**Requirements:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field. A Master’s degree is a plus.
* Minimum of 7+ years of progressive marketing experience. Experience in Enterprise/B2B Marketing is critical.
* Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with MCAE (or similar CRM systems) is essential.
* Demonstrated ability to develop and execute comprehensive, data-driven marketing strategies that align with business objectives.
* Proficiency in data analysis and the ability to use marketing metrics to optimize campaigns and strategies.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas and concepts to diverse audiences.
* Strong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple campaigns simultaneously.
* Excellent stakeholder management skills, with a proven ability to build reports and influence key decision-makers.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and scale-up environment, adjusting strategies as needed to respond to market changes. Ability to be solutions oriented and take initiative in the gray area.
* A passion for staying up-to-date with industry trends.


**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Business Applications Developer
description:
**You will be a part of…** 




 ...an international environment with colleagues all around Europe with our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. You will join a fast and innovative environment and be a part of a great-positioned company, with even higher ambitions for the future. Scrive is filled with caring, smart and committed people who know that we need to collaborate to win. We care about each other and encourage ourselves and each other in our aim to be better and grow, both as people and as a company. Come join us and be a part of Scrive’s successful journey!
 *🚀* 




  





 We are looking for a Business Applications Developer to our Revenue Operations team. You will be part of a team with two others reporting directly to our Head of Revenue Operations. This is a cross-functional role, where you will collaborate with other departments such as Finance, Data, and Revenue. You’ll work closely with both Operations Specialists and our Salesforce Administrator.
 



  





 You can either be located at our Stockholm Office and work in a hybrid setup (both office and from home), or totally remote if you are located elsewhere.
 



  





**Your challenge** 




 As a Business Applications Developer, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining our billing processes, ensuring seamless integration between Salesforce, PE Accounting and the backend of our product. You will own, manage and continuously develop two key middlewares that are in place to automate our billing and related processes. You will work proactively with improvements and testing to ensure a smooth billing process, a critical part of generating our positive cash flow.
 



  





 In your everyday work, your responsibilities will include:
 


* **Middleware Management:** 
 Own, manage and continue to develop the integration middlewares between Salesforce, PE, and our product backend to fetch usage data and ensure accurate billing.
* **Billing Processes** 
 : Oversee billing processes, ensuring timely and accurate invoicing, reconciliation, and reporting.
* **Salesforce Development** 
 : Own Salesforce development and handle development and administration tasks related to Salesforce. Mostly on Revenue Cloud (CPQ + Billing modules).
* **Solution Architecture:** 
 Own architectural design of business applications - including middlewares, integrations, and Salesforce code base. Ensuring scalability, performance, and security across our application landscape.
* **Custom Integration:** 
 Build the odd custom system integration for when the standard integration doesn’t cut it and ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* **Problem Resolution:** 
 Identify and resolve any issues related to billing, integrations, and system performance.
* **Documentation:** 
 Maintain detailed documentation of billing processes, system configurations, and integration workflows.



  





**Who we think you are** 




 We believe you are a constant improver, able to effortlessly build relationships with anyone at any time. To succeed in this role, you will need:
 


* Minimum 2 years of experience in developing system integrations/middlewares
* Proficiency in at least a few of the following programming languages - JavaScript, Java, C#, SQL, and/or Python is required
* Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in managing billing processes and system integrations
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams



  





**🌟 Also, big bonus points if you have:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, or a related field is preferred
* Familiarity with ERPs/Accounting systems, billing processes, and preferably accounting, such as having built these kinds of integrations and/or middlewares before is highly desirable
* Experience with Salesforce development (APEX) and administration is highly beneficial but not required



  





 Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway! Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We want to build a diverse and inclusive workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still want to hear from you.
 



  





 In this role we see that you are
 **problem solving** 
 ,
 **structured** 
 ,
 **flexible** 
 and
 **taking initiatives** 
 . We’re using a competence-based recruitment process where those competences will play an important role.

title: Executive Assistant to Vice President of MACH Products and Global Head HR
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


We are looking for an Executive Assistant to support our Vice President of MACH Products and Global Head HR at HVDC. You will become the right hand of these managers and provide executive support to maintain a high level of leadership – a central and important part of our Technology development journey.


You will have the joy of being the spider in the web, manage communication between upper management and employees, coordinating with internal and external executives on various projects & tasks and plan and orchestrate work to ensure that priorities are met, organizational goals are achieved, and best practices are upheld.


We offer you an exciting and dynamic role with close collaboration with customers, partners, other departments and teams at Hitachi Energy both locally and globally.

**How you´ll make an impact**

* Main task is to manage professional and personal service support and scheduling for the managers, including agendas, mail, email, calls, travel arrangements, client management, and other company logistics
* Coordinate scheduling and extensive calendar management, as well as management of content and flow of information to senior executives
* Arrange internal/external events, for example travel arrangements, itineraries, accommodation, conferences, visiting speakers etc.
* Organize team communications and plan events, both internally and offsite
* Perform administrative and management support, such as Minutes of Meetings (MoM), preparation of presentations, spreadsheet creation and maintenance of administration systems
* Administration and coordination of signatures of various documents while keeping professionalism and confidentiality
* Research, compile, verify and analyze information and issue special reports, presentations, organization charts, process maps, correspondence, etc. Coordinate meetings, agendas, MoM, actions and follow-up

**Your background**

* Experience in administrative role reporting directly to upper management
* Flexible and service-minded team player willing to adapt to changes and enjoys a challenge
* Time-management skills and the ability to organize, prioritize and coordinate multiple projects at once
* Great written and verbal communication skills, in English and Swedish
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems
* It is a merit to have knowledge about and experience of working in our business systems, for example eTime, Easy Procurement, Fieldglass, MyIS, Basware, Teams events, Visio
* Experience developing internal processes and filing systems is also a plus

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**More about us**


Are you ready to join Hitachi Energy for a career with no limits and a place where you can be yourself? We are ready for you.


Recruiting manager Peter Lundin, peter.lundin@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Eva Schölin, eva.scholin@hitachienergy.com.


The HVDC (high-voltage direct current) technology is a key enabler for a carbon-neutral energy system. It is highly efficient for transmitting large amounts of electricity over long distances, integration of renewables and interconnecting grids, opening up for new sustainable transmission solutions.


Please find out more about our world leading technology at https://www.hitachienergy.com/offering/product-and-system/hvdc

title: Senior Electrical R&D Engineer for power electronic valve development
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


Electrical design engineers develop the next-generation technologies in HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) that enable to transmit electricity over long distances and via submarine cables which provides billions to access electricity. As a electrical design engineer, you will work in R&D organization on a specific development project critical to Hitachi Energy needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve.


The current technology has enabled the connection of renewalbe energy such as large offshore wind and remote solar generators to the grid and brings clean energy to large cities. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas to make the power grid greener and smarter as we continue to push the technology forward.


Our team is a part of Hitachi Technology and Solutions Development in Ludvika, Sweden, and is responsible for the development of semiconductor based HVDC and SVC converter valves.


In this role, you get a broad network of contacts within Hitachi Energy's global organization and a good insight into how we work in different functions at Hitachi Energy. You will work in an inclusive environment with a team of competent, professional and friendly colleagues who will help you grow with the tasks.


Please find out more about our world leading technology at https://www.hitachienergy.com/

**How you´ll make an impact**

* Performing calculations and simulations to determine voltage stresses and losses in the semiconductors and valve electronics and verify your calculations with hands-on high power testing in our test laboratories.
* Conceptualize, simulate, develop and test power electronics circuits for high power transmission applications.
* Design and specify components, collaborate with suppliers, and plan and run tests on prototypes.
* Take responsibility for the design of electrical subsystems of our converter stations from ideation phase through concept and detail design to final test and verification.
* You will live Hitachi’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.
* You enjoy working agile and hands-on, and you are ready to take ownership of both the technology you’re working with, and your own personal development.
* We offer an exciting job in an international environment where you will get great possibili-ties to develop further within Hitachi Energy.

**Your background**

* A Master of Science in Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics or equivalent.
* 5 years or more of proven work experience from similar (power electronics) industries.
* Experience with working with laboratory equipment and converter prototyping and testing is a plus. If you have experience of power electronics in high voltage products , that would be an advantage.
* You are a natural team player and enjoy collaborating with others, find clever solutions and solve problems together.
* You are curious and interested in sustainability and the ongoing energy transition, and want to work on key technologies to solve one of the biggest challenges for humanity today.
* Experience with software like MATLAB or PSCAD is valuable.
* You are a natural problem solver, who enjoys meeting new challenges.
* It will be a part of your job to communicate with other departments, team members, projects leaders and suppliers. It is therefore important that you are open-minded and straightforward in your communication.
* As you will be part of a company that operates on the global arena, you must be proficient in English.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**Additional Information**


We are looking for an experienced, electrical Engineer, with power electronics and semi-conductor proven knowledge, willing and eager to join us developing the future Converter Valves.


Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join Hitachi and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams.


Hitachi Energy complementary strengths, we plan to form a new and stronger global leader in the power sector. Hitachi Energy will have more than 230 years of combined heritage and experience. Join us on this exciting journey.


Would you like to help us develop the HVDC technology of tomorrow? Welcome to apply today – don’t delay!


Recruiting Manager, Zahra Norouzian +46 725387060, will answer your questions on the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Oliver Chicaiza, oliver.chicaiza@hitachienergy.com.


Hitachi Energy strives to have a diverse and inclusive work environment and we welcome any gender candidates to apply.

title: Automotive Systems Engineer
description:
### **Requirements**


* **Software Development:** Design, develop, and maintain software for automotive steering systems, including Electric Power Assisted Steering System (EPAS), steer-by-wire, and advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) related to steering.
* **Control Algorithms:** Develop and implement control algorithms for steering systems to ensure precise and responsive vehicle handling.
* **Requirements Analysis:** Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyse software requirements for steering systems, ensuring alignment with overall vehicle design and performance goals.
* **System Integration:** Integrate software components with hardware steering systems, ensuring seamless functionality and performance. Work closely with hardware engineers to define software-hardware interfaces.
* **Testing and Validation:** Develop and execute test plans for steering software validation, including unit testing, integration testing, and system-level testing. Utilize simulation tools and real-world testing environments to ensure software reliability and safety.
* **Debugging and Troubleshooting**: Identify and resolve software issues and bugs related to steering systems. Perform root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to enhance software robustness.
* **Documentation:** Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for software design, development processes, and user manuals related to steering systems. Ensure documentation is up to date with industry standards and best practices.
* **Compliance and Standards:** Ensure software development processes comply with automotive industry standards, such as ISO 26262 for functional safety and ASPICE.
* **Continuous Improvement:** Stay abreast of the latest advancements in automotive steering software and technology. Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives and the adoption of new methodologies and tools.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with project managers, product owners, and other stakeholders to ensure timely delivery of high-quality steering software solutions

title: Cell Engineer
description:
**We bring visions to life.**

  

  

So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.


**Let’s introduce ourselves**

  

  

By following Volvo Cars´ vision, we need to master cell technology and efficiently integrate the cells in the battery pack and our vehicles. Our well-established Battery Department is at the heart of these efforts. Through cross-functional collaboration, we’re pushing the boundaries of battery engineering development. Our teams ensure we deliver high-quality, innovative electric vehicles to our customers on time, every time.


With us you will be part of a stimulating and creative workplace, ensuring excellent battery cell solutions for Volvo’s next-generation sustainable cars. The battery packs are designed and assembled in-house which requires a close relationship between internal design and verification teams, and our cell suppliers. We are involved in car programs from the concept phase to the vehicle release, as well as in aftermarket and quality improvement activities.


If you are seeking exciting opportunities for constant personal and professional growth as well as solving new challenges that arise within the fast-evolving electrification sector, then Volvo Cars might have the right opportunity for you!

  

  

**What you`ll do?**

  

  

As we are looking for several Senior Professionals in Battery System and Cell section, and specifically for Batter Cell Design. In this role you would leads cells sourcing and industrialization with a focus on developing the cell design and materials to balance the cell attributes' namely performance, safety, durability, sustainability, quality, and cost. Depending on your background and interest, you would be considered for a cell engineer with focus on one of the attributes such as **performance and safety.**  



If you are seeking exciting opportunities for constant personal and professional growth; as well as solving new challenges that arise within the fast-evolving electrification sector; then Volvo Cars Cell Design Group is the right place for you.


As a part of your role at Volvo Cars, your responsibilities will cover:


* Leading Cell Technical Development of cutting-edge battery cell technology from initial concept to full-scale industrialization.
* Drive Project Deliveries and Success on cell technical deliveries during crucial concept phases, ensuring alignment with Volvo's vision for sustainable mobility.
* Coordinating Cell Sourcing and collaborate with system architects and procurement teams to optimize our cell sourcing strategy, balancing cell design, attributes, and cost.
* Define Cell Specification and closely with system and product teams to transform high-level vehicle requirements into precise cell specifications, bridging the gap between vehicle performance and battery technology.
* Foster Supplier Partnerships with cell suppliers, guiding the design, evaluation, and validation processes to meet Volvo's standards.
* Enable Next-Gen Software Integration between battery CAE and software teams, using your deep cell knowledge to support the development of advanced control algorithms and diagnostics for Volvo Cars’ software-defined vehicles.
* Pioneer Testing Methodologies, design and implement innovative test methods and procedures at Volvo's state-of-the-art Battery Lab facilities, evaluating new cell chemistries, designs, and sub-system integrations.
* Drive Continuous Improvement by analyzing test results and market trends to recommend enhancements to cell technology, ensuring Volvo remains at the forefront of electric vehicle innovation.
* Cross-functional leadership and collaboration across departments to ensure seamless integration of battery technology into Volvo's broader vehicle architecture.

  

  

**What you´ll bring?**

  

  

We are looking for collaborative team members, who share our passion for evolving battery cell technologies, battery cell integration, automotive engineering, and sustainability. You tend to work independently, initiate improvements and prioritize tasks effectively to secure your project deliveries and investigations. You are an effective communicator of complex technical concepts towards external and internal stakeholders, have analytical approach and love solving problems.


You are committed to ethical and sustainable practices, which you will transfer also on suppliers and with that ensure we are leading the sustainable energy transformation. For us, it is important that you are eager to learn, develop and share knowledge and ideas on cell technology, collaborate and drive the innovative ideas to the next level.  

We believe you have a MSc or PhD Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Material Science or related fields, with at least 5 years of experience in the area.


This role offers a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of electric vehicle innovation, combining your technical expertise with Volvo's commitment to electrification and sustainability. If you're ready to drive the future of mobility and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you!

  

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**

  

  

Welcome with your application and we will reach back to you if we have an opportunity for you. Please submit your application until 20th of November.  

Please apply through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. We’re excited to get to know you!  

Location: Gothenburg, On-site

  

  

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:

We are looking for a **Test Automation Engineer** to join the team to build, support, and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient management of cost and schedule.


In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

Manage and utilize databases to store and retrieve test data efficiently Monitor automated tests, analyze results, and report defects.

title: Säljande managementkonsult
description:
Urval sker löpande Flera platser Hybrid
  
  

Vill du ta scenen och träna säljare och ledare i nya beteenden? Välkommen till Lime Intenz!
  
  

Följ med på vår tillväxtresa!
  
  

På Lime Intenz vill vi se fler företag leverera riktigt bra upplevelser till sina kunder. Vår passion ligger i att skapa framgångsrika säljorganisationer samt att utveckla ledarskap och en proaktiv företagskultur. Hela vår idé går ut på att träna kunder i bästa möjliga beteenden.
  
  

I dagsläget är Lime Intenz verksamma i Sverige och Norden, men det slutar så klart inte där. Lime Technologies expanderar på den europeiska marknaden och det öppnar upp för spännande möjligheter även för oss på Lime Intenz.
  
  

Intenz-teamet består idag av 8 goa kollegor och därutöver kommer du att få cirka 500 nya kollegor runt om i Europa. Teamet lever efter Pippis motto ”Det har jag aldrig provat, så det klarar jag helt säkert”. Idéer, den ständiga viljan att bli bättre och att kasta sig ut i det okända råder det alltså ingen brist på bland dina nya kollegor.
  
  

Vill du veta mer om oss? Du kan läsa om vad vi sysslar med och lära känna oss bättre här.
  
  

Vad kommer du att jobba med?
  
  

Rollen består av en spännande kombination av försäljning och leverans av utbildningar och workshops inom förändringsledning, säljträning, målstyrning och säljledarskap. Från start kommer du följa med seniora kollegor ut, tränas i våra nuvarande paket och modeller och kommer tidigt att få kliva in och hjälpa nya Lime CRM-kunder med deras förändringsresa för att ge dem rätt förutsättningar att komma i gång med sitt nya CRM-system. Här har du möjlighet att jobba med merförsäljning utifrån varje kunds specifika behov för att bli en långsiktig samarbetspartner. Troligen är nästa steg på deras resa att träna sina säljfärdigheter eller att jobba bättre med målstyrning i och utanför sitt nya verktyg. Du kommer även få leverera på insålda projekt där du tränas och coachas inför dina utbildningar och workshops.
  
  

För sälja in våra paket och bygga upp din egen kundstock har du den gyllene möjligheten att primärt prospektera på Limes befintliga kunder och genom leads från organisationen, genom tajt samarbete med CRM-säljare och projektledare. Du har också frihet att bearbeta andra bolag som du anser behöver din hjälp. Du ansvarar för hela säljkedjan med dina kunder, men i teamet hittar du stöttning och bollplank av kollegor och chefer som gärna hejar på.
  
  

Vid leverans kommer du att träffa kunden antingen fysiskt eller digitalt, med allt från 5 till 15 deltagare där du ska utmana deras beteende och säljkultur samt träna dem i nya säljtekniker. Det är utmanande, otroligt kul och ger en kick som är riktigt svår att hitta någon annanstans, om du frågar oss. Målgrupperna för dina workshops är ofta ledare, säljare eller kundservice och uppläggen är allt från korta insatser över 3–6 månader till större strategiska upplägg som återkommer under flera år.
  
  

Några av våra medarbetare
  
Anna-Mari Ewing
  
Sales Operations Specialist
  
"Om du ger uttryck för dina ambitioner och vad du behöver för stöd, så finns det stora möjligheter att utveckla din karriär med oss."
  
Matilda Alm
  
Account Manager
  
"På Lime trivs jag med fantastiska kollegor och en inspirerande kultur. Möjligheterna att utmanas och växa som säljare gör varje dag spännande och unik."
  
Terry Ilebode
  
Software Engineer
  
"Lime ger mig ett holistiskt stöd i alla delar av mitt liv genom att både utmana mig som mjukvaruutvecklare och ge mig stöd i min personliga utveckling."
  
Henrik Kjærvik
  
Head of Expert Services
  
"Det bästa med att jobba på Lime, förutom kollegorna så klart, är flexibiliteten och möjligheterna att utveckla din karriär i linje med dina egna mål och ambitioner."
  
Kvalifikationer
  
  

Vem letar vi efter?
  
  

Du har 4-8 års erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning där du har drivit hela säljkedjan självständigt – med framgångsrikt resultat (starkt meriterande om du har erfarenhet av IT)
  
Du brinner för försäljning och ser fram emot att lära dig att sälja och leverera något som för dig kanske är helt nytt
  
Du utstrålar trygghet och pondus och kan ta dig an ett rum med för dig okända personer
  
Du tar ansvar för samt strukturerar upp ditt eget arbete
  
Du har en eftergymnasial utbildning
  
Du talar och skriver både svenska och engelska obehindrat (extra kul om du bemästrar något övrigt nordiskt språk)
  
Tidigare erfarenhet av säljledning, coachning och/eller interaktiva grupputbildningar är ett stort plus
  
  

Placering
  
  

Just nu söker vi våra framtida kollegor med placering i Lund, Göteborg eller Stockholm. Du kommer dels att utgå från ditt lokala kontor och genomföra kundmöten och digitala leveranser. Under mer intensiva perioder kommer du också förväntas att vara på resande fot någon dag i veckan, främst inom Sverige och i vissa fall i Norden.
  
  

Ingen tid att vänta – sök nu!
  
  

Vi rekryterar löpande och tillsätter tjänsten så fort vi hittar rätt person.
  
  

Konferenser och sociala aktiviteter
  
  

Träning och utveckling
  
  

Balans i (jobb)livet
  
  

Kaffe, dricka och fika
  
  

Hälsa och välmående
  
  

Bygga Lime tillsammans
  
  

Om företaget
  
  

Lime är ett börsnoterat techbolag med 9 kontor i 6 länder. Vi växer konstant med ca 20 % per år och öppnade under hösten 2020 vårt första utomnordiska kontor i Nederländerna. Sedan dess har vi äntrat Tyskland och har ständigt ögonen öppna för nya, potentiella marknader. Men det där är bara siffror och fakta. Det riktigt härliga med Lime är vi som jobbar här - ett stort gäng omtänksamma, ambitiösa kollegor som kämpar för en värld där alla kundupplevelser överträffar förväntningarna. Med hjälp av smart teknik och träffsäker expertis förenklar vi kunders vardag och skapar förutsättningar för det där lilla extra. Något som fortfarande är unikt för ett mjukvarubolag som Lime är också att vi sköter hela produktlivscykeln själva - allt från utveckling, till leverans, till support. Vi tar helt enkelt ansvar för att kedjan är hel och välfungerande, med en twist. Vi kallar det #dontbreakthechain.
  
  

Lime grundades av tre studenter i Lund år 1990
  
  

Lime klimatkompenserar genom grön el från en solcellspark utanför Sjöbo
  
  

Lime har gjort sex företagsförvärv sedan år 2017
  
  

Limes nuvarande VD Nils började som en av de första traineerna år 2006
  
  

Lime introducerades på Nasdaq i Stockholm år 2018
  
  

Lime lanserade sitt omvända mentorskapsprogram år 2019
  
  

Limes mjukvara har en räckvidd på ca 100 miljoner människor dagligen
  
  

Cornelia Olsérius | Kontaktperson

title: Engineering Technical Specialist
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  


**Let’s introduce ourselves**

  


Our team is dedicated to creating a safer, more sustainable future through cutting-edge interior sensing technologies. We develop and improve interior sensing technology for vehicles, focusing on areas such as radar, cameras and other optical sensors. Our team is responsible for providing strategic and scientific input, solving technical issues, keeping up with global trends and customer needs, and sharing our expertise within the organization. We are looking for a passionate and experienced professional to join us in shaping the future of automotive interiors.

  


**What you’ll do?**

  


The vehicle industry provides a rapidly changing environment constantly introducing new complex challenges. As Technical Specialist for Interior Sensing, you will have a central role in shaping Volvo Cars future by building knowledge and defining strategies within the area. You will work together with a highly motivated development team and have access to Volvo Cars technical specialist community.


Your responsibilities will be:


* Defining Volvo Cars interior sensing technology strategies (mid and long term).
* Systematically build knowledge within the area through research and supplier collaborations.
* Collaborate with different key roles within the company to understand Volvo Cars future needs and priorities within the area.
* Follow and influence development of legislation and industry standards within the area.
* Communicating with suppliers.
* Working on legal aspects to ensure compliance and innovation.
* Providing scientific and strategic input to address and resolve key technical issues.
* Conduct global intelligence to understand trends, customer needs and benchmark against competitors.
* Acting as a “go-to person” for advice and guidance within your area of expertise.
* Developing organizational knowledge by teaching, mentoring, and coaching team members.
* Aligning with internal stakeholders on future needs and defining business value.
* Investigating business cases built on investments versus revenue.
* Bringing offered technologies to company decisions.
* Continuously developing and reviewing the complete electrical and software framework for interior sensing to understand architectural roadblocks and their impact on time, technology, cost, and resource strategies.

**What you’ll bring?**

  


To be successful in this role, you should have:


* At least 10 years of experience in the relevant field, with a strong background in sensing technologies and experience with electrical and software frameworks.
* A deep understanding of the automotive industry, including both hardware and software.
* Excellent knowledge of radars and other sensing technologies.
* Systematic and scientific approach.
* Knowledge in machine learning and ML verification.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with universities, institutes, and high-level management.
* Ability to explain complex things in a way that is easy to follow.
* Proficiency in English, speech and writing.
* An analytical and strategic mindset, with strong problem-solving skills.
* An understanding of legal and safety aspects related to automotive technology.

**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
--------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Anastasiia Maidanyk at anastasiia.maidanyk@volvocars.com. For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Pia Landby at PIA.LANDBY@VOLVOCARS.COM.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 26th of November 2024. We’re excited to get to know you!

  

  

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!

title: Executive Assistant to Vice President of MACH Products and Global Head HR
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


We are looking for an Executive Assistant to support our Vice President of MACH Products and Global Head HR at HVDC. You will become the right hand of these managers and provide executive support to maintain a high level of leadership – a central and important part of our Technology development journey.


You will have the joy of being the spider in the web, manage communication between upper management and employees, coordinating with internal and external executives on various projects & tasks and plan and orchestrate work to ensure that priorities are met, organizational goals are achieved, and best practices are upheld.


We offer you an exciting and dynamic role with close collaboration with customers, partners, other departments and teams at Hitachi Energy both locally and globally.

**How you´ll make an impact**

* Main task is to manage professional and personal service support and scheduling for the managers, including agendas, mail, email, calls, travel arrangements, client management, and other company logistics
* Coordinate scheduling and extensive calendar management, as well as management of content and flow of information to senior executives
* Arrange internal/external events, for example travel arrangements, itineraries, accommodation, conferences, visiting speakers etc.
* Organize team communications and plan events, both internally and offsite
* Perform administrative and management support, such as Minutes of Meetings (MoM), preparation of presentations, spreadsheet creation and maintenance of administration systems
* Administration and coordination of signatures of various documents while keeping professionalism and confidentiality
* Research, compile, verify and analyze information and issue special reports, presentations, organization charts, process maps, correspondence, etc. Coordinate meetings, agendas, MoM, actions and follow-up

**Your background**

* Experience in administrative role reporting directly to upper management
* Flexible and service-minded team player willing to adapt to changes and enjoys a challenge
* Time-management skills and the ability to organize, prioritize and coordinate multiple projects at once
* Great written and verbal communication skills, in English and Swedish
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems
* It is a merit to have knowledge about and experience of working in our business systems, for example eTime, Easy Procurement, Fieldglass, MyIS, Basware, Teams events, Visio
* Experience developing internal processes and filing systems is also a plus

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
* More benefits could be connected to this specific role

**More about us**


Are you ready to join Hitachi Energy for a career with no limits and a place where you can be yourself? We are ready for you.


Recruiting manager Peter Lundin, peter.lundin@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. Any other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Eva Schölin, eva.scholin@hitachienergy.com.


The HVDC (high-voltage direct current) technology is a key enabler for a carbon-neutral energy system. It is highly efficient for transmitting large amounts of electricity over long distances, integration of renewables and interconnecting grids, opening up for new sustainable transmission solutions.


Please find out more about our world leading technology at https://www.hitachienergy.com/offering/product-and-system/hvdc
